messages.title: Change Britain's Future
messages.content: Bridget is the ONLY viable alternative to the Conservatives who take NW Cambridgeshire for granted, even more so now that UKIP has collapsed. Bridget has the right experience for the job; she has worked in education and the NHS and is now a consultant in Community and Business Development.

Bridget is a Lib Dem because education and equal opportunities for everyone are at the heart of Lib Dem policy. She believes everyone deserves a good education, timely health and social care, and good access to affordable housing and employment opportunities.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Bridget will ensure that new housing meets local people's needs: 40% of ALL new housing is affordable and is for local people. Developers HAVE to provide sufficient funding for infrastructure including roads, schools and health provision. New housing needs to be matched with new jobs.

Bridget will protect your access to good health and social care by: Making sure housing developments contribute early to primary health care costs. Supporting communities to provide help for carers close to where people live. Promoting local health education and healthy living support for all ages.

Bridget will ensure that access to education meets the local need: Keep the new mayor to the promised University for Peterborough. Fighting for fair funding for ALL pupils and schools. Informing developers to build new schools in advance of housing. Fight to keep free school meals for Infants.

Bridget will deliver Local Jobs for Local People in NW Cambridgeshire by promoting the region's affordable premises with good transport links, cheaper housing and a skilled workforce. By working with the new mayor to double the number of apprenticeships. By understanding how inward investment will work for the region.

Bridget believes we deserve a choice over the Brexit Deal because: Any deal will cost us money and we have a right to know how much. We need to know if we will lose jobs. We need to understand the full impact of Brexit while we still have a choice.
